intro: Impatiens thomassetii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. The flowers come in a range of colors, including white, pink, and purple, and bloom throughout the year under proper care.
